evidence.name: James Carter (Victim Profile)
evidence.description: Profile information for James Carter, a 35-year-old cab driver found deceased. Known to have gambling problems and significant financial debt.

evidence.name: Queens Alley Crime Scene
evidence.description: Initial scene description from the alley in Long Island City where James Carter's body was discovered beside his cab. Notes the rain-slicked ground and minimal lighting.

evidence.name: Metallic Object Near Body
evidence.description: An initial observation from the crime scene noted a metallic object located near James Carter's head, suggesting a potential murder weapon.

evidence.name: Luca Dogwalker (Witness Profile)
evidence.description: Profile and statement from Luca Dogwalker, the witness who discovered James Carter's body while walking his dog and called 911. He reported seeing a blur in the dark.

evidence.name: Ryan Cole (Suspect Profile)
evidence.description: Background information on Ryan Cole, the gruff owner of Kings Cab Garage. Known to have had a financial dispute with James Carter over unpaid fees.

evidence.name: Lucas Reed (Suspect Profile)
evidence.description: Background information on Lucas Reed, a loan shark known to operate in Queens. James Carter owed him a substantial amount of money.

evidence.name: Natalie Parker (Suspect Profile)
evidence.description: Background information on Natalie Parker, James Carter's ex-girlfriend. She is a single mother with a daughter who has significant medical issues.

evidence.name: James Carter's Financial Troubles
evidence.description: Investigation into James Carter's finances revealed significant debt and a history of gambling, creating potential motives for multiple parties.

evidence.name: Strained Relationship with Natalie Parker
evidence.description: Information indicates James Carter's relationship with his ex-girlfriend, Natalie Parker, ended badly and involved financial conflict.

evidence.name: Lack of Forced Entry (Apt/Cab)
evidence.description: There were no signs of forced entry at James Carter's apartment or his cab, suggesting the killer may have been known to him or had access.

evidence.name: Ryan Cole's Ledger
evidence.description: A ledger from Kings Cab Garage documenting James Carter's outstanding debt for storage fees, confirming Ryan Cole's stated motive.

evidence.name: IOU from James Carter to Lucas Reed
evidence.description: A document detailing the substantial sum of money James Carter owed to loan shark Lucas Reed, establishing a strong financial motive for Reed.

evidence.name: Head Trauma Details
evidence.description: Forensic examination and autopsy revealed blunt force trauma to the back of James Carter's head as the cause of death.

evidence.name: Metal Fragments in Wound
evidence.description: Metal fragments were found embedded in the head wound, providing a crucial clue about the material composition of the murder weapon.

evidence.name: Missing Wrench Outline (Cab Toolbox)
evidence.description: Examination of James Carter's cab toolbox revealed an empty slot with a dust outline, indicating a wrench was recently removed and is missing.

evidence.name: Natalie Parker's Medical Bills
evidence.description: Unpaid medical bills for Natalie Parker's daughter, visually demonstrating her financial strain and the urgency of her need for money.

evidence.name: Wrench Stolen from Cab
evidence.description: Natalie Parker admitted to taking a wrench from James Carter's cab during a fare earlier on the day of the murder, providing the means.

evidence.name: CCTV Figure Matches Natalie Parker
evidence.description: Analysis of security camera footage from near the crime scene shows a figure matching Natalie Parker's build and gait around the time of the murder.

evidence.name: CCTV Capture: Figure Dropping Object
evidence.description: Grainy security footage shows the figure matching Natalie Parker discarding a heavy object into a sewer grate near the crime scene shortly after the murder.

evidence.name: Bloody Wrench (Sewer Grate)
evidence.description: A wrench was recovered from the sewer grate identified in the CCTV footage. It is stained dark, consistent with blood, and matches the description of the missing tool from James Carter's cab.

evidence.name: Forensic Analysis: Metal Fragments
evidence.description: Laboratory report confirming that the metal fragments found in James Carter's wound match the composition of the wrench recovered from the sewer.

evidence.name: Motive: Money for Daughter's Treatment
evidence.description: Investigation revealed James Carter stole money from Natalie Parker that she desperately needed for her diabetic daughter's medical treatments, establishing her powerful motive for revenge.

evidence.name: Lucas Reed's Confirmed Alibi
evidence.description: Evidence, including cell tower data and witness confirmation, placed Lucas Reed in Brooklyn at the time of the murder, clearing him of opportunity.

evidence.name: Ryan Cole's Statement and Alibi Check
evidence.description: Ryan Cole's statement confirms his argument and pursuit of James Carter but places him back inside the garage at the time of the murder. Investigation found no evidence contradicting this or linking him directly to the means.

evidence.name: Natalie Parker's Confession
evidence.description: Natalie Parker confessed to killing James Carter, detailing her motive (revenge for stealing her daughter's medical funds) and method (using the wrench taken from his cab).

passages.name: Initialization
passages.description: Passage to initialize all game aspects.

components.subTitle: A cab driver found dead in a Queens alley. The city waits.

components.imageDescription: Crime scene with yellow cab and body beside it

lines: A rain-slicked alley, a yellow cab glowing sickly under a lone lamp.
James Carter, a cab driver, is a crumpled shape beside his vehicle.
Just got the ping. Carter, huh?
This wasn't a stray bullet or a random mugging.

components.imageDescription: Flashback to talking to the witness

lines: Said he saw something, but it was dark.

components.imageDescription: Flashback to a stack of bills

lines: To a shark, maybe? Cabbies always do.
Or was it closer than that?

lines.text: Choose how to phrase your update.

branch.description: How do you sum up the scene and initial thoughts for ADA Song?

options.name: Text ADA: 'Feels cold, Song. Like someone had a score to settle...'
options.description: Share your gut feeling

options.name: Text ADA: 'Witness saw a blur, dark. Didn't get much...'
options.description: Report on the witness encounter

options.name: Text ADA: 'Could be debt. ...Reed's name came up...'
options.description: Suggest financial motive lead

lines.text: Just got the ping. Carter, huh? Any initial read? What's the scene telling you?

options.name: Visit Kings Cab Garage
options.description: Interview Ryan Cole

options.name: Visit Lucas Reed's 'Office'
options.description: Interview the loan shark

options.name: Search Victim's Apartment
options.description: Look for clues in Carter's home

options.name: Visit Natalie Parker (Ex-GF)
options.description: Talk to the ex-girlfriend

options.name: Examine Cab Toolbox
options.description: Check the victim's cab for tools

options.name: Analyze CCTV Footage
options.description: Look for suspects on security cameras

options.name: Review Evidence
options.description: Examine collected evidence

options.name: Review Suspect Dossiers
options.description: Read suspect background info

options.name: View Case Briefing
options.description: Review the full case summary

options.name: Check Objectives
options.description: See current investigation goals

lines.text: Okay, detective, I've compiled the case details. Here's a summary: James Carter, 35, cab driver, found dead outside his cab in Queens. Blunt force trauma to the head. Metallic fragments found in wound. Suspects include the garage owner (financial dispute), a loan shark (large debt), and the ex-girlfriend (strained relations, possible financial issue).

branch.description: Anything specific from the briefing, detective, or back to the hub?

options.name: Return to Hub
options.description: Go back to main investigation view

lines.text: Alright, let's clarify our current objectives: Identify the murder weapon, Determine the killer's motive, Eliminate suspects without opportunity/means, and Accuse the culprit.

options.name: Return to Hub
options.description: Go back to main investigation view

lines.text: Okay, let's review Ryan Cole's profile. He owns Kings Cab Garage. We know he had a heated argument with Carter just before the murder over unpaid fees. He was even seen holding a baseball bat, but he claims Carter just drove off. Let's consider what this tells us and decide your next step.

branch.description: Focus your thoughts on Ryan Cole

options.name: Cole's vibe & debt focus
options.description: Share your read on his demeanor and financial motive angle.

options.name: Observation on the bat
options.description: Mention the baseball bat seen and his claim.

options.name: Evaluate his alibi
options.description: Consider if his story about Carter leaving holds up.

options.name: Return to Investigation Hub
options.description: Go back and explore other leads.

passages.name: Action Chain Step 1
passages.description: Automatically generated intermediate passage for action chain.

lines.text: Processing action 1 of 3...

passages.name: Action Chain Step 2
passages.description: Automatically generated intermediate passage for action chain.

lines.text: Processing action 2 of 3...

passages.name: Action Chain Step 3
passages.description: Automatically generated intermediate passage for action chain.

lines.text: Processing action 3 of 3...
Reed. Ugly business... What's the feel there?

branch.description: How do you text ADA Song about Reed?

options.name: Text: 'Reed's smooth, ADA... Brooklyn alibi. Place is sterile. Money and fear live there.'
options.description: Give ADA a character read.

options.name: Text: 'Shark watched his watch the whole time... Didn't sweat Carter's death much.'
options.description: Highlight suspicious demeanor.

options.name: Text: 'Reed confirms Carter owed him... losing a cash cow.'
options.description: Focus on the financial angle and cynicism.

options.name: Return to Investigation Hub
options.description: Go back to the main investigation view.

lines.text: Okay, Detective. Let's take a look around Carter's place. It's pretty worn - looks like stacks of bills, cluttered surfaces everywhere. There's a small toolbox near the door that seems a bit out of place. What do you want to examine?

options.name: Examine Bills on Table
options.description: Look at the stack of papers.

options.name: Examine Toolbox near Door
options.description: Check the condition of the toolbox.

options.name: Check Entry Method
options.description: Look for signs of forced entry.

options.name: Return to Investigation Hub
options.description: Go back to the main investigation screen.

lines.text: Okay, Detective. Looking closer at these bills... they're all overdue notices, final demands. Seems James was definitely in deep financial trouble, just like Reed mentioned.

options.name: Text ADA: Bills everywhere. Carter was drowning in debt. Confirms Reed's story on that end.
options.description: Text ADA Song about the bills.

commands.evidenceAlias: IOU from James Carter to Lucas Reed

lines.text: Here's a basic toolbox by the door. Huh. It's surprisingly clean and organized, considering the rest of the apartment is a mess. That's odd. Something to report back to ADA about?

options.name: Text ADA: Odd. Toolbox by his door is clean, organized. Rest of the place is a dump. Why keep the tools so tidy?
options.description: Text ADA Song about the toolbox.

lines.text: Let's check the entry point. The apartment door and frame... no pry marks, no forced damage. It looks like the killer had a key, or Carter let them in. Just like the cab scene. Suggests someone he knew, maybe?

options.name: Text ADA: Nothing missing I can see. No forced entry. Like the alley. Someone he knew? Or they had a key.
options.description: Text ADA Song about the lack of forced entry.

lines.text: Got the prelim from Forensics. Metal fragments in the wound point to blunt force. Cabbies usually carry a toolkit. Check Carter's? See what it tells you.

options.name: Examine the cab toolbox
options.description: Look inside for clues.

lines.text: Missing wrench, dust outline... fits the fragments. Good eye, detective. Looks like you found the weapon. Get back here when you can, let's tie this up.

options.name: Text ADA Song
options.description: Inform ADA about the missing wrench.

lines.text: Okay, let's look into Natalie Parker. She's the ex-girlfriend, right? Single mother, I remember. Something about her daughter's medical issues came up, and Carter apparently screwed her over on some money. Seems like a strong angle to explore.

options.name: Access Natalie's Profile
options.description: View her background and potential motive.

lines.text: Alright. Looking at Natalie's profile... The details about her daughter's health crisis and the money James stole are definitely significant. This seems like more than just a breakup. What's your gut feeling on her potential motive, before we meet her?

options.name: Text ADA: 'Desperation motive'
options.description: Text: 'Single mom, sick kid. Carter screwing her over for $$ needed for meds? Desperation is a hell of a motive.'

options.name: Text ADA: 'Bad blood/Money issue'
options.description: Text: 'Ex-girlfriend angle always messy. Could be breakup revenge, or maybe concrete like that money dispute.'

options.name: Text ADA: 'Capability/Kid leverage'
options.description: Text: 'Nurse's aide knows anatomy? Quiet type can be dangerous. But the kid's health... is that the leverage? Or motive?'

components.imageDescription: Small, clean apartment. Pictures of a young girl.

lines: Natalie: "James? He was a mistake. A bad gamble."
Natalie: "Money? He took what he needed. Didn't care who it hurt."

components.imageDescription: Hand rests near a photo of her daughter.

lines: Natalie: "My daughter's everything. Everything I do is for her."
Small scar on her hand. Hands are steady.
She didn't ask how James died.

lines.text: Okay, you met Parker. What's your read? Give me the rundown.

options.name: Text: Money/Kid motive
options.description: Share impression about financial motive tied to her daughter.

options.name: Text: Composure/Scar
options.description: Comment on her steady hands, possible scar, lack of surprise.

options.name: Text: Desperation Angle
options.description: Frame her statements as desperation due to Carter's actions.

lines.text: Okay, let's re-evaluate the CCTV footage near the garage. Is there anything we might have missed?

options.name: Analyze Footage Closely
options.description: Review the video from near Kings Cab Garage

lines.text: Reviewing the footage frame-by-frame... found a figure. Small build, moving fast. Not Cole, not Reed.

options.name: Follow Figure's Path
options.description: See where the figure goes on the recording

lines.text: The figure pauses near a sewer grate... then discards something heavy.

options.name: Connect the Pieces
options.description: Think about the discarded object and other evidence

lines.text: That figure... matches Natalie Parker's build. Discarding something heavy into the sewer grate... like the missing wrench from Carter's cab.

options.name: Text ADA: It was Parker.
options.description: Send the critical breakthrough observation to ADA Song

lines.text: Got it. CCTV footage reveals a figure matching Natalie Parker discarding a heavy object into a sewer grate near the scene.

options.name: Investigate the Sewer Grate
options.description: Direct uniforms to search the specified sewer grate

passages.name: Intermediate Breakthrough Moment 9 New Path Investigate Action 2
passages.description: Automatically generated intermediate passage for action chain

lines.text: Processing action 2 of 3

passages.name: Intermediate Breakthrough Moment 9 New Path Investigate Action 3
passages.description: Automatically generated intermediate passage for action chain

lines.text: Processing action 3 of 3
Okay, let's focus on the sewer grate at the location from the CCTV. It could hold a clue.

options.name: Examine Grate
options.description: Look closer at the sewer grate.

options.name: Return to Investigation Hub
options.description: Go back to the main investigation view.

lines.text: The grate looks heavy, probably rusted tight. Be careful prying it open.

branch.description: The grate is open. Search inside?

options.name: Search Inside
options.description: Look down into the darkness.

lines.text: Something glinting in the muck? Get it out of there. Could be important.

branch.description: You found the weapon. Examine it?

options.name: Examine Wrench
options.description: Take a closer look at the stained wrench.

lines.text: Let's look at that wrench closely. Any details match what we know about the crime scene or the victim's cab?

branch.description: The weapon is found and identified. What's next?

options.name: Text ADA: The Wrench!
options.description: Report the confirmed murder weapon to ADA Song.

options.name: Return to Hub
options.description: Go back to the main investigation view.

components.imageDescription: Natalie Parker behind glass in Interrogation Room 1, looking small
Lucas Reed leaning back in a witness room, smirking
Ryan Cole pacing in a witness room, muttering
The tagged wrench sitting on an interrogation room table

lines.text: Got everyone in place, Detective. Parker's ready. Reed and Cole are prepped. Your call on the approach. How do you want to play this?

options.name: Text ADA: Set up Wrench & CCTV
options.description: Tell ADA your plan to use the wrench and footage first.

options.name: Text ADA: Lay out the case
options.description: Tell ADA you'll present money, wrench, CCTV.

lines.text: We're set up in the hallway, just outside the interrogation room. Parker's inside. Cole and Reed are standing by. Feeling the tension... What should I text ADA Song about the setup?

options.name: Text ADA: Setup
options.description: Describe the scene: Parker, Reed, Cole standby, wrench ready.

lines.text: Parker's here. Reed and Cole standing by? Good. Your call when to bring her in and what to hit her with.

options.name: Hit her with CCTV & Wrench
options.description: Start with the concrete evidence.

options.name: Lay out all known evidence
options.description: Build the complete picture first.

lines.text: Natalie Parker is in the interrogation room. You lay out the evidence: the money Carter stole, her daughter's illness, the missing wrench from his cab, the CCTV footage showing her near his car and dumping something in the sewer. The pressure is building. Now, observe her reaction.

options.name: Observe Her Reaction
options.description: Watch how she responds to the evidence.

lines.text: Natalie is turning pale, eyes fixed on her daughter's photo in her wallet. Her composure is gone, replaced by raw fear and desperation. Her eyes keep returning to the photo. The true motive is coming into focus. Now, text ADA Song about this breakthrough.

options.name: Text ADA: Focus on the Kid
options.description: Tell ADA the daughter's medical bills were the real reason.

options.name: Text ADA: Focus on Desperation
options.description: Tell ADA it was about being trapped, no other way.

lines.text: That's it then. Parker. The wrench, the money for the kid. Damn. Rough business. Get some sleep, detective.

options.name: Await Confession
options.description: Wait for her to break.

lines.text: Okay, Detective. Verdict's in: Natalie Parker. Ready for the full story?

The full story: Natalie Parker killed James Carter using a wrench stolen from his cab earlier that day. Her motive was revenge for Carter stealing money she desperately needed for her diabetic daughter's medical treatment. She waited for him...
Ready to review the evidence that sealed the case?
Check out the timeline of the crime.
Here's a visualization of the connected evidence.
Key evidence: Missing Wrench Outline (Cab Toolbox), Bloody Wrench (Sewer Grate), CCTV Capture: Figure Dropping Object, Medical Bills (Natalie's Apartment), and Natalie's Confession.
We can now conclude the investigation.

Epilogue: With Natalie Parker's confession and the evidence chain complete, the case is closed. The city's underbelly remains, but for tonight, justice found a corner in Queens. Parker faces charges, leaving her daughter's future uncertain. Another sad story written...
Credits and acknowledgments are available.
Case is complete.
